body_content.explanation: consisting of or relating to particles (= extremely small pieces of matter, like those that make up an atom) that move very fast:
examples: The astronomers used extremely high-energy gamma rays to capture images of the faraway planet.
The machine produces high-energy X-rays that are used to help treat people who have cancer.

body_content.explanation: having a lot of energy that allows you to move, run, do work, etc., without getting tired:
examples: She is very busy taking care of her two high-energy young children.
The player's high-energy attitude has been an inspiration to the other players on the team.

body_content.explanation: made up of substances that give you a lot of energy to move, run, do work, etc., without getting tired:
examples: She keeps high-energy protein bars in her desk at work for when she starts to feel sluggish late in the day.
The tennis player follows a high-energy, low-fat diet created specially for her by her personal trainer.
